intro: Cirsium × woronowii, commonly known as the hybrid thistle, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its spiny, lance-shaped leaves and purple to pink flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
